RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui doutorado em Nuclear and industrial safety Engineering - ( Bio Medical) Universit di Pisa em 5 de Julho (2013). Tem experincia na rea de Engenharia nuclear safety, com nfase em Bio Medical em Boron neutron capture therapy (BNCT), atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: bonner sphere spectrometer, unfolding code, shadow cone technique, Monte Carlo methods, BNCT e proteco contra. radiaes.Visitor Academic (Ps-Doc) na Faculdade de Cincias da Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal no contexto de uma colaborao entre o Instituto de Biofsica e Engenharia Biomdica (IBEB) e do Centro de Fsica Nuclear (CFNUL) na era de fsica de radiaes aplicada a medicina ate final de 2013.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: I am working at Physics Department of Federal University of Sergipe (UFS) on project (fiber and gel dosimetry) as Postdoctoral Junior (PDJ) with a fellow of the CNPq [150159/2016-1] for the period from 01/02/2016 to 08/31/2016.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
I put an email which I recived of Editor.
Ms. Ref. No.: ARI-D-14-00271 Title: Estimation of scattering contribution in the calibration of neutron devices with radionuclide sources in rooms of different sizes Applied Radiation and Isotopes
Dear Mrs. Nafiseh Mirzajani,
Thank you for agreeing to review manuscript number ARI-D-14-00271 for Applied Radiation and Isotopes.
If possible, I would appreciate receiving your review by 06/06/2014.
Please note that, if present, we ask you to include Highlights and the Graphical Abstract in the reviewing process.
You may submit your comments online at the Elsevier Editorial System: http://ees.elsevier.com/ari/. Please login as a Reviewer using the following username and password:
Your username is: n.mirzajani@ing.unipi.it If you need to retrieve password details, please go to: http://ees.elsevier.com/ARI/automail_query.asp.
You may access the manuscript by selecting the "Pending Assignments" link on your Main Menu page. To submit your comments, please click on the "Submit Reviewer Recommendation" link. There you will find spaces for confidential comments to the editor, comments for the author and a report form to be completed.
As a reviewer you are entitled to complimentary access to Scopus and ScienceDirect for 30 days. Your 30-day access can be activated in your "Pending Assignments" page in EES and you have 6 months to activate it. From the Scopus search bar on your "Pending Assignments" page you can access Scopus directly and from there seamlessly access full text articles on ScienceDirect. You can also access Scopus and ScienceDirect directly via www.scopus.com/reviewers, using your EES Username and Password.
*Scopus is the world's largest abstract and citation database of research information and quality internet sources.
Using your EES login details, you can access Scopus from either the url below or the Scopus search bar that will appear at the top of your assignments page in EES
The

Authors may submit the manuscript as a single file Word or PDF to be used in the refereeing process, and the manuscript formatting will only reflect the peer review requirements. ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Department of Civil and Industrial Engineering, University of Pisa

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Winner of PhD grant in Nuclear and industrial safety Engineering, Major: Biomedical Course. University of Pisa, Pisa, Italy, 2009.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Physics Department of Federal University of Sergipe (UFS)
the ICTP program for training and research in Italian laboratories

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Winner of research grant in the ICTP program for training and research in Italian laboratories for four months from first of February until end of May, 2012.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Faculty of Sciences of University of Lisbon

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Academic Visitor (Post-Doc) at Faculty of Sciences of University of Lisbon, Portugal in the context of collaboration between Institute of Biophysics and Biomedical Engineering (IBEB) and Centre of Nuclear Physics (CFNUL)

I worked in the Nuclear Measurements Laboratory (UNIPI) and in Laboratori Nazionali of Legnaro in Italy as follows: 1-Set up of a Bonner Sphere Spectrometer for an accelerator-based BNCT Facility 2-Setup of the BINS superheated drop detectors spectrometer and application to the Be (p, n) neutron energy spectrum determination were studied. In this research, superheated drop detectors (SDDs) were used for neutron spectrometry of the Be (p, n) reaction by exploiting the different response to neutron energy, according to operating temperature or pressure of the superheated liquid. In this work, the Bubble Interactive Neutron Spectrometer (BINS), based on superheated emulsions of dichlorotetrafluoroethane and octafluorocyclobutano operated in the range of 30-55 C, is considered.
3- The response of innovative neutron detectors with monoenergetic neutron beams was investigated. In this research different neutron detectors studied such as SiC sandwich neutron spectrometer, thermoluminescent crystal (LiAlSi2O6) which are sensitive to gamma radiation and also to neutron fields, due to the boron content and CR-39 track etched detectors investigated for measurements in the wide energy range neutron fields in gamma-neutron mixed fields. Finally the response of the detectors compared to the superheated drop detectors (SDDs) response.
